intro: Lessingia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually glandular-pubescent, meaning they have small, sticky glands covering the surface. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
